subSections.title: Translingual
subSections.text:
<!-- Doesn’t exist yet: {{stroke order|strokes=14}} -->
{{Han simplified forms|漢|漢|汉}}

subSections.title: Alternative forms
subSections.text: * In [[Traditional Chinese]], Japanese [[kyūjitai]], Korean [[hanja]] and Vietnamese [[Hán Nôm]], the component [[File:U26c29-ue0102.svg|25px|text-bottom|𦰩󠄂|link=𦰩]] for this character is written with {{l|mul|廿}} on top. Note that the bottom portion is written {{l|mul|口}} overlapped by {{l|mul|夫}} and not {{l|mul|中}} on top of {{l|mul|天}}. * In Japanese [[shinjitai]], the component [[File:U26c29.svg|25px|text-bottom|𦰩|link=𦰩]] is written with {{l|mul|sc=Jpan|艹}} on top and has one stroke less. Due to [[w:Han unification|Han unification]], both traditional Chinese and Japanese shinjitai forms are encoded under the same [[code point]]. The appearance of this character will differ depending on the font used. * In [[Simplified Chinese]], the component [[File:U26c29-ue0102.svg|25px|text-bottom|𦰩󠄂|link=𦰩]] is simplified to {{l|mul|又}} instead, giving the character {{l|mul|汉}} (U+6C49). * Two [[w:CJK Compatibility Ideographs|compatibility ideographs]] exist for this character. U+FA47 corresponds to the [[kyūjitai]] form of this character while U+FA9A corresponds to the alternative form used in North Korea which is similar to Japanese shinjitai.

subSections.title: Kanji
Readings
Compounds
Etymology 1
Noun
Derived terms
Proper noun
subSections.text:
{{ja-pos|proper|かん}}

# the name of [[China]] during the {{w|Han dynasty}} (206 {{BCE}} – 220 {{CE}})
# name of various [[Chinese]] [[dynasty|dynasties]]
## the {{m|ja|西漢|tr=Saikan||Western Han}} or {{m|ja|前漢|tr=Zenkan||Former Han}} (206 {{BCE}} – 9 {{CE}})
## the {{m|ja|東漢|tr=Tōkan||Eastern Han}} or {{m|ja|後漢|tr=Gokan||Later Han}} (25–220 {{CE}})
## the {{m|ja|蜀漢|tr=Shokkan||{{w|Shu Han}}}} (221-263)
## the {{m|ja|前趙|tr=Zenchō||{{w|Former Zhao}}}} (304–329)
## the {{m|ja|成漢|tr=Seikan||{{w|Cheng Han}}}} (304–347)
## the {{m|ja|南漢|tr=Nankan||{{w|Southern Han}}}} (917–971)
## the {{m|ja|後漢|tr=Kōkan||{{w|Later Han}}}} (947–951)
## the {{m|ja|北漢|tr=Hokukan||{{w|Northern Han}}}} (951–979)
# the {{w|Han Chinese}} [[people]]
# the {{w|Han River}}, a [[tributary]] of the [[Yangtze]]
# {{lb|ja|sort=かん|by extension|_|from the "river" sense}} the [[Milky Way]]
#: {{synonyms|ja|天漢|tr1=Tenkan|天河|tr2=Tenga|銀漢|tr3=Ginkan|銀河|tr4=Ginga|天の川|tr5=Ama-no-gawa}}
# alternative name for {{m|ja|漢中|tr=Kanchū||{{w|Hanzhong}}}}
# {{surname|lang=ja|A=a|nodot=1|sort=かん}}

subSections.title: Etymology 3
subSections.text:
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|あや}}

From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=あや|-}}, in reference to clans purportedly originating from China.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref><ref name="DJS">{{R:Daijisen}}</ref>  Appears to be cognate with {{m|ja|文}} / {{m|ja|紋}} / {{m|ja|綾}} / {{m|ja|絢|tr=aya||a pattern or design; a pattern of diagonally interweaving lines; twill; how something fits together, the reason or background of a thing; skillful expression in color or words; melody, tune}}, possibly in distant reference to technologies and cultural practices brought to Japan by the original Chinese immigrants.
